intro: Tournefortiopsis torrana, commonly known as the Torrana rockrose, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features small, evergreen leaves and produces clusters of showy, pink or red flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
